2020-08-09T14:54:09Z: And that's it from us for this weekend! We've got the Spanish GP next weekend - and it's likely to be a scorcher. Hasta luego!
2020-08-09T14:52:54Z: Here's the report of the 70th Anniversary GP - we hope you enjoyed it! F1 70th Anniversary GP: Verstappen beats Hamilton and Bottas at SilverstoneMax Verstappen beat Lewis Hamilton and Valtteri Bottas as the softer tyres and hot temperatures at Silverstone led to Red Bull defeating Mercedes in Formula 1's 70th Anniversary Grand Prix
2020-08-09T14:49:19Z: There's the Austrian national anthem, which has been a part of post-race proceedings for, er, more times than that.
2020-08-09T14:48:32Z: At least, I think it's the ninth time - I didn't really have time to check.
2020-08-09T14:48:08Z: There's the Dutch national anthem for the ninth time on an F1 podium.
2020-08-09T14:38:29Z: Amazing how those who complained that the tyres were too soft are now extolling the virtues of bringing softer compounds. But that's none of my business...*kermit tea meme*
2020-08-09T14:34:56Z: Ocon, Norris and Kvyat are the rest of the scorers in this race. Barely seen a peep out of them, let's be honest!
2020-08-09T14:34:21Z: Leclerc one-stops it to fourth, Albon fifth, and Stroll rounds out Hulkenberg for sixth.
2020-08-09T14:33:54Z: Lewis Hamilton recovers second place, and Valtteri Bottas completes the podium.
2020-08-09T14:33:18Z: Max Verstappen WINS the 70th Anniversary Grand Prix!
2020-08-09T14:32:08Z: Aha, another Keystone Copse moment from Albon. Good move.
2020-08-09T14:31:34Z: Albon's now up to fifth, clearing Stroll. Leclerc's probably a bit far up the road now, but he's on some nasty-looking tyres.
2020-08-09T14:30:49Z: Bottas had nothing going for him there - his left-rear tyre is incredibly blistered.
2020-08-09T14:30:11Z: Hamilton tracks Bottas into the first few corners, stays the course and fires past Bottas down into Brooklands.
2020-08-09T14:29:33Z: Hamilton really closing in on Bottas at Stowe, but Bottas just kept it in the middle of the course.
2020-08-09T14:28:19Z: We're into the final few laps now, and Hamilton's just a second behind Bottas. Game on.
2020-08-09T14:27:19Z: Ocon is looking to brave it out with the one-stop strategy for Renault. He is currently in P8 but has Norris for company under two seconds behind him.
2020-08-09T14:26:35Z: Hamilton is eating into Bottas' advantage now. Just a couple of seconds in it...
2020-08-09T14:25:02Z: That Hulkenberg stop for softs is very weird - did he have a tyre issue?
2020-08-09T14:24:15Z: Hamilton, now clears Leclerc at Stowe, and now regains his place on the podium.
2020-08-09T14:24:13Z: Magnussen is the first retirement of the race as he parks his car in the garage. A race to forget for the Haas driver.
2020-08-09T14:23:23Z: The German rejoins in seventh, as Stroll and Albon pass.
2020-08-09T14:22:55Z: Hulkenberg pits from fifth, for soft tyres! This is an interesting call...
2020-08-09T14:22:17Z: Hamilton's now right on Leclerc's tail, taking the circumspect route into Stowe.
2020-08-09T14:21:41Z: Albon's eating into Stroll's advantage too - he's looking rapid with another recovery drive.
2020-08-09T14:21:07Z: Hamilton does a 1m28.451s. He's not speeding in the pitlane, but he's speeding on the circuit at a vast rate of knots.
2020-08-09T14:20:31Z: Hamilton's been on the radio to ask about his late braking for the pitlane, and if he broke the speed limit. He's been given the all-clear so far, it seems.
2020-08-09T14:19:25Z: Albon sets the fastest lap of the race with a 1m29.899s as he comfortably leads the midfield runners, but unfortunately for him Stroll is 10 seconds up the road in sixth place.
2020-08-09T14:17:56Z: Hamilton will rejoin in fourth place, behind Leclerc.
2020-08-09T14:17:31Z: Verstappen duly obliges, taking a second out of Hamilton to force him into pitting.
2020-08-09T14:16:50Z: Verstappen's slashed the gap to Hamilton, which is now 8.9s. He's been given the command to push by his engineer Gianpiero Lambiase.
2020-08-09T14:15:32Z: For two laps in a row Vettel runs wide on the exit of Stowe which will get the race stewards on his case if he continues with that. The Ferrari driver is currently running in P12 in between Gasly and Sainz.
2020-08-09T14:13:36Z: Hamilton has found some pace, getting into the high 1m30s - although Verstappen's still faster at this point.
2020-08-09T14:12:00Z: Mercedes will be presumably taking mediums late into the race, but they're just trying to keep the six-time champion in the game at the moment.
2020-08-09T14:10:55Z: Hamilton's also concerned that the tyre might go, but he's told the blistering is the cause of the pace drop. Still, it's risky.
2020-08-09T14:09:41Z: Still no sign of Hamilton pitting just yet, possibly worried that he'll get dropped among the Racing Points at this stage of the race.
2020-08-09T14:09:28Z: Kvyat does indeed pit at the end of lap 35, while behind him Albon gets ahead of Ocon for P7.
2020-08-09T14:08:13Z: Kvyat and Ocon lead the F1 midfield fight but both are due to stop for a second time in this race.
2020-08-09T14:04:01Z: Verstappen and Bottas both pit, then. That was a short medium stint for Verstappen - and return in the order that they pitted.
2020-08-09T14:02:44Z: Ricciardo has spun at Turn 3! He had Sainz on his outside but it doesn't look like the pair touched. That has dropped the Renault driver down to P12.
2020-08-09T14:02:31Z: It's a 1m30.361s for Verstappen. That's full send, isn't it?
2020-08-09T14:01:42Z: Hulkenberg pits from fourth, and returns to the road in sixth on the hard tyre in acres of clean air.
2020-08-09T14:00:12Z: Leclerc, meanwhile, plonks in a 1m30.668s to set the fastest lap.
2020-08-09T13:59:25Z: While Verstappen is dominating at the front, it is also turning into a strong race for Albon as he gets ahead of Norris to take P7.
2020-08-09T13:58:18Z: Hulkenberg's now within 10s of Hamilton, lapping a couple of tenths faster than the Mercedes driver per lap.
2020-08-09T13:55:46Z: Bottas' lead lasts all of six corners.
2020-08-09T13:55:39Z: Bad news for Magnussen, who gets a five-second time penalty for his incident with Latifi.
2020-08-09T13:54:55Z: Bit of a slow tyre on for Verstappen, meaning Bottas has grabbed the lead! But for how long?
2020-08-09T13:54:45Z: Half-race distance and Gasly, Russell and Magnussen have all pitted twice already and are duly at the back of the field.
2020-08-09T13:52:55Z: Verstappen was a second faster than Bottas on that previous lap too. The plot thickens every lap we get here at Silverstone.
2020-08-09T13:52:09Z: Hamilton reports blistering - he's now 21.4s away from Verstappen as of lap 26.
2020-08-09T13:50:59Z: Verstappen might have earned himself a free pitstop here, as the Mercedes lads are really, really struggling.
2020-08-09T13:49:15Z: Eeek, iffy pitstop for Sainz. He's certainly two-stopping as he's on the medium compound rubber.
2020-08-09T13:48:46Z: Sainz pits, releasing Hulkenberg back into fourth place.
2020-08-09T13:48:10Z: On lap 22 Albon gets ahead of Gasly for P12. The Red Bull driver goes around the outside while Gasly's rear tyres look cooked already and he simply doesn't have enough grip.
2020-08-09T13:47:57Z: Speculation that Verstappen might be planning an audacious one-stop strategy. If he can get those hards through the first 30-32 laps, it might be possible.
2020-08-09T13:46:49Z: Mercedes' pace has really dropped now, back into the high 1m32s. Verstappen? 1m31.5s. Spicy.
2020-08-09T13:45:43Z: Hulkenberg's now on Sainz's tail. Sainz has yet to pit, having started on the hards.
2020-08-09T13:45:06Z: How about this for a contest, Gasly against Albon. The AlphaTauri driver is defending against his Red Bull rival but the French driver's rear tyres look in bad shape despite having pitted not long ago.
2020-08-09T13:44:37Z: Pace-wise, Verstappen is still going faster than Bottas, 0.4s quicker than the Mercedes driver did on that previous lap.
2020-08-09T13:42:44Z: Leclerc's in too, relinquishing fifth place for fresh boots.
2020-08-09T13:41:55Z: Stroll now comes in to pit, then, leaving Verstappen the last of the front runners yet to come in.
2020-08-09T13:39:30Z: Bottas has now ended up with a 3.6s lead over Hamilton on lap 17, thanks to stopping a lap sooner.
2020-08-09T13:38:26Z: Albon isn't hanging around this afternoon as he keeps his foot planted to power around the outside of Raikkonen at Copse for P15. The brave move pays off.
2020-08-09T13:38:25Z: Hulkenberg now pits for new tyres, coming out well ahead of Ricciardo to cover that threat off.
2020-08-09T13:37:49Z: Bottas has done a 1m30.971s. A timely switch for fresh tyres, then.
2020-08-09T13:37:24Z: So, Verstappen now leads from Hulkenberg and Stroll. The Racing Points kept their distance, and should be able to go deeper into the race on the mediums.
2020-08-09T13:36:34Z: Ricciardo drops out of the top six and pits too.
2020-08-09T13:35:29Z: It seems that Verstappen's speed has really pressured Mercedes into stopping, as Hamilton is set to come in for fresh boots.
2020-08-09T13:34:48Z: Max, meanwhile, is really giving Lewis a run for his money.
2020-08-09T13:34:27Z: Bottas now pits, calling it a day on those mediums.
2020-08-09T13:33:42Z: Norris the latest to pit for hard tyres at the end of lap 12 and returns to the action ahead of Gasly and Albon.
2020-08-09T13:30:51Z: Gasly, on the fresh hard tyres, gets ahead of Raikkonen - who is yet to pit - at Stowe to move up to P14. Both Williams drivers and Magnussen have also opted for early stops for the hard tyre.
2020-08-09T13:28:20Z: Looking at the laptimes, Verstappen did a 1m32.4 last time round - the Mercedes cars in the 1m32.6s bracket.
2020-08-09T13:26:53Z: Verstappen is slowly reeling Hamilton in, crucially on those harder tyres. The Mercedes drivers are having to manage tyres already.
2020-08-09T13:26:16Z: A lap later Gasly also pits, having been in seventh, and is joined by Giovinazzi for a switch to fresh hard tyres.
2020-08-09T13:25:09Z: It'll be interesting to see how early the rest of the field switches to the hard tyre, after Albon's early stop.
2020-08-09T13:24:16Z: Albon is the first to pit at the end of lap six, having been runnning behind Norris in ninth place, and takes on the hard tyres.
2020-08-09T13:23:05Z: Bottas has now scarpered out of DRS range from Hamilton, but he's having to lift through Copse to put the left-front under less strain.
2020-08-09T13:23:03Z: Vettel, on his recovery drive, is up to 18th having got past Latifi and Raikkonen and is chasing Russell now.
2020-08-09T13:21:45Z: Times at the front within the 1m32s - Verstappen was slightly faster than Hamilton on that previous tour.
2020-08-09T13:20:01Z: We're on the fourth lap now - Hamilton's just lurking in DRS range of Bottas, but seems to be flitting in and out of range over the lap.
2020-08-09T13:18:53Z: Replays of the race start confirm Vettel spun all by himself at the first corner. When it rains it pours for the Ferrari driver at the moment. He was inches away from clattering into Sainz during the spin too.
2020-08-09T13:18:38Z: Very good traction from Verstappen off the line, given the harder compound. That Honda engine managing the torque very well.
2020-08-09T13:17:44Z: First fastest lap to Bottas, a 1m31.384s. DRS is now enabled.
2020-08-09T13:16:46Z: Lap 2, then - Hamilton's within DRS range of Bottas and he'll be hoping to hang in there once it's activated. Verstappen's in his customary P3.
2020-08-09T13:16:39Z: Strong starts for both Giovinazzi and Magnussen who gained four positions each on the opening lap. Magnussen is up to P13 and Giovinazzi is P15.
2020-08-09T13:15:45Z: Stroll's cleared Ricciardo for P5, and the Racing Points are line astern.
2020-08-09T13:15:14Z: Hamilton throws the kitchen sink at Bottas into Brooklands, but the Finn hangs on to the lead!
2020-08-09T13:15:08Z: Disaster start for Vettel! He spins around on the exit of the first corner and is now in last place - was there contact to trigger that spin?
2020-08-09T13:14:46Z: Verstappen gets Hulkenberg at the start, as Bottas preserves the lead!
2020-08-09T13:14:06Z: And the 70th Anniversary Grand Prix is go, go, go!
2020-08-09T13:12:46Z: The drivers line up on the grid, ready to get this 70th Anniversary party started...
2020-08-09T13:11:38Z: We've got track temps of 42.7 degrees C, so that's quite hot. Wouldn't want to walk that barefooted...
2020-08-09T13:10:20Z: Those soft tyres are a bit like that drunk uncle at a party - they're unpredictable and nobody wants to go near them.
2020-08-09T13:09:46Z: Sainz is also on hards, according to our timing screens.
2020-08-09T13:08:57Z: In terms of tyres: Verstappen, Vettel, Kvyat and Raikkonen begin on hards. The rest? Mediums.
2020-08-09T13:08:15Z: Here we go then, just a couple of minutes until the drivers begin the not-British GP.
2020-08-09T13:02:41Z: Wolff and Brown have a quick chat in the pitlane - ex-Formula Ford racer Brown presumably asking about taking Hamilton's seat for next season.
2020-08-09T13:01:42Z: On an unrelated note, how many tickles does it take to make an octopus laugh? Ten tickles.
2020-08-09T12:57:18Z: Ricciardo could be a factor too, having looked very quick on the hard tyre this weekend. That's also the compound Verstappen will be starting on, as everyone will probably be avoiding the softs like the plague.
2020-08-09T12:56:39Z: All eyes will be on the two Mercedes at the front, as Hamilton aims to get past Bottas into a difficult opening set of corners. And what can Hulkenberg and Verstappen do?
2020-08-09T12:54:08Z: Conditions were a bit muggy at Silverstone earlier but, as things hot up, the tyres are going to be a big factor in today's race. Should be an exciting one.
2020-08-09T12:46:34Z: We've just watched the most stunning MotoGP race, and if F1 can be just a smidgen as good as that, we're in for a corker.
2020-08-09T12:46:05Z: Good afternoon everyone! It's just 25 minutes until we get underway for the F1 70th Anniversary GP - so get yourself a cool drink, plonk yourself on your favourite spot on the sofa, and get ready for all the action.
